00281 
00282         struct MemPoolBlockInfo;
00283 
00284         struct MemPoolBufferInfo
00285         {
00286             uint32 iBufferPreFence;             // Pre-fence to check for memory corruption
00287             OsclAny* iStartAddr;                // Starting memory address of the memory pool buffer after the buffer info
00288             OsclAny* iEndAddr;                  // Ending memory address of the memory pool buffer
00289             uint32 iBufferSize;                 // Total size of the memory pool buffer including the buffer info header
00290             uint32 iNumOutstanding;             // Number of outstanding blocks from this memory pool buffer
00291             MemPoolBlockInfo* iNextFreeBlock; // Pointer to the next free memory block
00292             uint32 iAllocatedSz;                //Number of butes allocated from the mempool
00293             uint32 iBufferPostFence;    // Post-fence to check for memory corruption
00294         };
00295 
00296         struct MemPoolBlockInfo
00297         {
00298             uint32 iBlockPreFence;              // Pre-fence to check for memory corruption
00299             MemPoolBlockInfo* iNextFreeBlock; // Pointer to the next (right neighbor) free block in the buffer. NULL if none.
00300             MemPoolBlockInfo* iPrevFreeBlock; // Pointer to the previous (left neighbor) free block in the buffer. NULL if first free block
00301             uint32 iBlockSize;                  // Total size of the block including the block info header
00302             uint8* iBlockBuffer;                // Pointer to the buffer area of the block
00303             MemPoolBufferInfo* iParentBuffer; // Pointer to the block's parent memory pool buffer
00304             uint32 iBlockPostFence;             // Post-fence to check for memory corruption
00305         };
00306 
00307     protected:
00308

00317         void deallocateblock(MemPoolBlockInfo& aBlockPtr);
